ORDINANCE NO. 8-1997
ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 1997 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 1997 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 1997 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 1997
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk of the
municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary of all new matters
contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23.
SECTION 3:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.

ORDINANCE 5-2003
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2003 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2003 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2003 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2003
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk of the
municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary of all new matters
contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23.
Such summary is attached hereto and marked as "Exhibit A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2003
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   A.   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2003 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   B.   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect immediately upon its
approval by the legislative authority and signature of the Mayor, as provided
for by Ohio Revised Code, §§ 731.17 and 731.30. The reason for the emergency is
to immediately conform the ordinances of the Village of Navarre to recent
changes in Ohio laws, in order to avoid any conflict between them.
Passed (as an emergency measure and under suspension of rules):
July 7, 2003
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor

   We, Robert L. Benson, Mayor, and Mary Ann Heestand, Clerk- Treasurer of the

Exhibit A
OHIO BASIC CODE, 2003 EDITION — SUMMARY OF CONTENTS
Notice is hereby given that on the 7th day of July, 2003, there was enacted by
the Legislative Authority of the Municipality of Navarre , Ohio, an ordinance
entitled “An Ordinance Approving, Adopting and Enacting American Legal
Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2003 Edition, as the Code of Ordinances for the
Municipality of Navarre, Ohio.”
A summary of the subjects, including all new matters contained in the Code of
Ordinances, as adopted, are as follows. The majority of Basic Code provisions
are based directly on state law.

ORDINANCE NO. 1-2004
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2004 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2004 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2004 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2004
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk-Treasurer of the
Legislative Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept
in its initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk-
Treasurer of the municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary
of all new matters contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio
Revised Code § 731.23. Such summary is attached hereto and marked as "Exhibit
A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2004
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   A.   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2004 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   B.   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect immediately upon its
approval by the legislative authority and signature of the Mayor, as provided
for by Ohio Revised Code, §§ 731.17 and 731.30. The reason for the emergency is
to immediately conform the ordinances of the Village of Navarre to recent
changes in Ohio laws, in order to avoid any conflict between them.
Passed (as an emergency measure and under suspension of rules):
January 5, 2004
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
Attest:
Mary Ann Heestand /s/
Clerk-Treasurer
   I, Mary Ann Heestand, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do
hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of Ordinance #1-2004 duly
passed and adopted by the Council of the Village of Navarre on the 5th day of
January, 2004, as compared by me with the original on file in my office.
                     Mary Ann Heestand /s/
   I, Mary Ann Heestand, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do
hereby certify that there is no newspaper in said Village and that publication
of the above Ordinance was duly made by posting one copy thereof at each of the
five places designated by Council and that said Ordinance will remain posted
for at least fifteen days thereafter.
   Village Auto Parts, Sky Bank, Navarre Post Office, Surbey Feed & Supply,
Village Clean Laundromat
                     Mary Ann Heestand /s/
   Exhibit A
   OHIO BASIC CODE, 2004 EDITION — SUMMARY OF CONTENTS
Notice is hereby given that on the 5th day of January, 2004, there was enacted
by the Legislative Authority of the Municipality of Navarre , Ohio, an
ordinance entitled “An Ordinance Approving, Adopting and Enacting American
Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2004 Edition, as the Code of Ordinances for
the Municipality of Navarre, Ohio.”
A summary of the subjects, including all new matters contained in the Code of
Ordinances, as adopted, are as follows. The majority of Basic Code provisions
are based directly on state law.

ORDINANCE NO. 2-2005
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2005 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2005 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2005 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2005
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk-
Treasurer of the municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary
of all new matters contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio
Revised Code § 731.23. Such summary is attached hereto and marked as "Exhibit
A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2005
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   (A)   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2005 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: 1-17-05
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
                     Mary Ann Heestand /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority

   Exhibit A
   OHIO BASIC CODE, 2005 EDITION — SUMMARY OF CONTENTS
Notice is hereby given that on the 17th day of January , 2005, there was
enacted by the Legislative Authority of the Municipality of Navarre , Ohio, an
ordinance entitled “An Ordinance Approving, Adopting and Enacting American
Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2005 Edition, as the Code of Ordinances for
the Municipality of Navarre, Ohio.”
A summary of the subjects, including all new matters contained in the Code of
Ordinances, as adopted, are as follows. The majority of Basic Code provisions
are based directly on state law.
   TITLE I: GENERAL PROVISIONS
   Chapter 10: General Provisions
Section
   10.01   Short titles
   10.02   Definitions
   10.03   Rules of construction

ORDINANCE NO. 2-2006
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2006 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY.
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2006 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2006 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2006
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk of the
municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary of all new matters
contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23.
Such summary is attached hereto and marked as "Exhibit A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2006
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   (A)   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2006 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: 1-23-06
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
                     Mary Ann Heestand /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority
   CERTIFICATION OF CODIFIED ORDINANCES
   We, Robert L. Benson, Mayor, and Mary Ann Heestand, Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, of the Municipality of Navarre, Ohio, pursuant to Ohio Revise Code
§§ 731.23 and 731.42, hereby certify that the general and permanent ordinances
of the Municipality, as revised, rearranged, compiled, renumbered as to
sections, codified and printed herewith in component code and titles are
correct as and constitute the Code of Ordinances for the Municipality of
Navarre, Ohio.
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
                     Mary Ann Heestand /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority
   I, Mary Ann Heestand, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do
hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of Ordinance #2-2006 duly
passed and adopted by the Council of the Village of Navarre on the 23rd day of
January, 2006, as compared by me with the original on file in my office.
                     Mary Ann Heestand /s/
   I, Mary Ann Heestand, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do
hereby certify that there is no newspaper in said Village and that publication
of the above Ordinance was duly made by posting one copy thereof at each of the
five places designated by Council and that said Ordinance will remain posted
for at least fifteen days thereafter.

Such summary is attached hereto and marked as "Exhibit A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2007
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   (A)   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2007 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: 2-5-07
                     Stephen Morelli /s/
                     Mayor (Acting)
                     Anne Johnson /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority

ORDINANCE NO. 2-2008
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2008 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY.
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2008 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2008 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2008
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk of the
municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary of all new matters
contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23.
Such summary is attached to Ordinance 2-2008 and marked as "Exhibit A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2008
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   (A)   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2008 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: 2-4-08
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
                     Anne L. Johnson /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority
ORDINANCE 5-2008
ORDINANCE ADOPTING THE 2008, S-21 SUPPLEMENT OF REPLACEMENT PAGES FOR THE
CODIFIED ORDINANCES OF THE VILLAGE OF NAVARRE, OHIO, AS SUBMITTED BY AMERICAN
LEGAL PUBLISHING CORPORATION OF CINCINNATI, OHIO, CONSISTING OF MATERIAL
INCORPORATING PREVIOUSLY ADOPTED ORDINANCES AND RESOLUTIONS, AND MATERIAL
INCORPORATING RECENT CHANGES IN STATE LAW, AND DECLARING THE SAME TO BE AN
EMERGENCY.
WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the health, safety and welfare of the
residents of the Village of Navarre, Ohio, to provide for the adoption of the
2008, S-21 supplement of replacement pages for the Codified Ordinances of the
Village of Navarre, Ohio, which supplement contains all ordinances of a general
and permanent nature enacted since the prior supplement to the Code of
Ordinances of the Village, and material incorporating recent changes in State
law; and,
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation has recommended the revision or
addition of certain sections of the Code of Ordinances which are based on or
make reference to various sections of the Ohio Revised Code; and,
WHEREAS, it is the intent of Council to accept these updated sections in
accordance with the changes of the law of the State of Ohio; and,
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
Village and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, safety
and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect as soon
as possible; and,
WHEREAS, said replacement pages consist of:
REMOVE OLD PAGES            INSERT NEW PAGES
Title Page               Title Page
Village Officials Page         Village Officials Page
   ADOPTING ORDINANCE
--                     117 through 124
   TITLE XVII: MUNICIPAL REGULATIONS
3, 4   3, 4
7 through 10B   7 through 10D
30A, 30B   30A, 30B
79, 80   79, 80
121 through 134B   121 through 134L
141 through 142B   141 through 142B
144A, 144B   144A, 144B
150A through 150D   150A through 150D
153 through 158   153 through 158
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE VILLAGE OF NAVARRE, STATE
OF OHIO, THAT:
SECTION 1: The replacement pages as specified above are hereby adopted and
inserted into the Codified Ordinances of the Village of Navarre, Ohio,
consisting of material incorporating previously adopted ordinances, and
material incorporating recent changes in State law.
SECTION 2: These replacement pages are available for inspection at the office
of the Clerk-Treasurer of the Village of Navarre, 27 West Canal St., Navarre,
Ohio 44662, in accordance with O.R.C. § 731.23.
SECTION 3: This ordinance is hereby declared to be an emergency ordinance as it
is of immediate necessity to the health, safety, and welfare of the residents
of the Village of Navarre, Ohio, that the replacement pages for the Codified
Ordinances of said Village, as enumerated above, be adopted and inserted
immediately. The reason for the emergency is that, without said replacement
pages being immediately and properly adopted and inserted, the Codified
Ordinances do not represent the current versions of the various ordinances
previously passed and recent changes in State law, and, for the effective
functioning of the Village government the codified Ordinances should
immediately be brought up-to-date. Therefore, this ordinance shall take effect
immediately upon its passage by Council and signature of the Mayor, as provided
for by Ohio Revised Code, §§ 731.17 and 731.30.
Passed (as an emergency and under suspension of rules): March 3, 2008.
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
Attest:
Anne L. Johnson /s/
Clerk-Treasurer

hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of ORDINANCE #5-2008 duly
passed and adopted by the Council of the Village of Navarre on the 3RD DAY OF
MARCH, 2008 as compared by me with the original on file in my office.
                     Anne L. Johnson /s/

ORDINANCE NO. 2-2010
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2010 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY.
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2010 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2010 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2010
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk of the
municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary of all new matters
contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23.
Such summary is attached to Ordinance 2-2010 and marked as "Exhibit A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2010
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   (A)   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2010 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provisions of the
Ohio Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   Whenever reference is made in any documents, publications, or
signs of the municipality, including but not limited to traffic tickets and
traffic-control signs, to a section as it existed in a former edition of the
Ohio Basic Code, the reference shall extend and apply to the section referred
to as subsequently amended, revised, recodified, or renumbered.
SECTION 5:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: January 18, 2010
                     Robert L. Benson /s/

ORDINANCE NO. 6-2010
AN ORDINANCE ENACTING AND ADOPTING A SUPPLEMENT TO THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR
THE VILLAGE OF NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation of Cincinnati, Ohio, has
completed the 2010 S-22 - Title XVII supplement to the Code of Ordinances of
the Political Subdivision, which supplement contains all ordinances of a
general and permanent nature enacted since the prior supplement to the Code of
Ordinances of this Political Subdivision; and
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE POLITICAL
SUBDIVISION OF THE VILLAGE OF NAVARRE:
SECTION 1:   That the 2010 S-22 - Title XVII supplement to the Code of
Ordinances of the Political Subdivision as submitted by American Legal
Publishing Corporation, as attached hereto, be and the same is hereby adopted
by reference as if set out in its entirety.
SECTION 2:   Such supplement shall be deemed published as of the day of its
adoption and approval by the Legislative Authority and Clerk of the Political
Subdivision is hereby authorized and ordered to insert such supplement into the
copy of the Code of Ordinances kept on file in the Office of the Clerk.
SECTION 3:   This ordinances is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
PASSED AND ADOPTED by the Legislative Authority of the Political Subdivision on
this 2nd day of August, 2010.

construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provision of the Ohio
Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   Whenever reference is made in any documents, publications, or
signs of the municipality, including but not limited to traffic tickets and
traffic-control signs, to a section as it existed in a former edition of the
Ohio Basic Code, the reference shall extend and apply to the section referred
to as subsequently amended, revised, recodified, or renumbered.
SECTION 5:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: March 2, 2015
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
                     Anne L. Johnson /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority
                     Anne L. Johnson
ORDINANCE NO. 3-2016
AN ORDINANCE APPROVING, ADOPTING AND ENACTING AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING'S OHIO
BASIC CODE, 2016 EDITION, AS THE CODE OF ORDINANCES FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF
NAVARRE, OHIO, AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY.
WHEREAS, the present general and permanent ordinances of the municipality are
inadequately arranged and classified and are insufficient in form and substance
for the complete preservation of the public peace, health, safety and general
welfare of the municipality and for the proper conduct of its affairs.
WHEREAS, American Legal Publishing Corporation publishes a Code of Ordinances
suitable for adoption by municipalities in Ohio.
WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily operation of the
municipality and for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health,
safety and general welfare of the municipality that this ordinance take effect
at an early date.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE LEGISLATIVE AUTHORITY OF THE MUNICIPALITY
OF NAVARRE, OHIO:
SECTION 1:   American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2016 Edition, as
reviewed and approved by the Legislative Authority, is hereby adopted and
enacted. Any prior version of the Ohio Basic Code which may have been
previously adopted by the municipality is hereby repealed as obsolete and is
hereby replaced in its entirety by this Ohio Basic Code, 2016 Edition.
SECTION 2:   One copy of American Legal Publishing's Ohio Basic Code, 2016
Edition, certified as correct by the Mayor and Clerk of the Legislative
Authority, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23, shall be kept in its
initial form on file in the office of the Clerk of the municipality and
retained as a permanent ordinance record of the municipality. The Clerk of the
municipality is authorized and directed to publish a summary of all new matters
contained in the Code of Ordinances as required by Ohio Revised Code § 731.23.
Such summary is attached to Ordinance 3-2016 and marked as "Exhibit A".
SECTION 3:   All ordinances and resolutions or parts thereof which are in
conflict or inconsistent with any provision of the Ohio Basic Code, 2016
Edition, as adopted by Section 1 hereof, are hereby repealed as of the
effective date of this ordinance, except as follows:
   (A)   The enactment of the Ohio Basic Code, 2016 Edition, shall not be
construed to affect a right or liability accrued or incurred under any
legislative provision prior to the effective date of such enactment, or an
action or proceeding for the enforcement of such right or liability. Such
enactment shall not be construed to relieve any person from punishment for an
act committed in violation of any such legislative provision, nor to affect an
indictment or prosecution therefor. For such purposes, any such legislative
provision shall continue in full force notwithstanding its repeal for the
purpose of revision and codification.
   (B)   The repeal provided for above shall not affect:
      (1)   The grant or creation of a franchise, license, right, easement or
privilege;
      (2)   The purchase, sale, lease or transfer of property;
      (3)   The appropriation of expenditure of money or promise or guarantee
of payment;
      (4)   The assumption of any contract or obligation;
      (5)   The issuance and delivery of any bonds, obligations or other
instrument of indebtedness;
      (6)   The levy or imposition of taxes, assessments or charges;
      (7)   The establishment, naming, vacating or grade level of any street or
public way;
      (8)   The dedication of property or plat approval;
      (9)   The annexation or detachment of territory;
      (10)   Any legislation enacted subsequent to the adoption of this
ordinance;
      (11)   Any legislation specifically superseding the provision of the Ohio
Basic Code.
SECTION 4:   Whenever reference is made in any documents, publications, or
signs of the municipality, including but not limited to traffic tickets and
traffic-control signs, to a section as it existed in a former edition of the
Ohio Basic Code, the reference shall extend and apply to the section referred
to as subsequently amended, revised, recodified, or renumbered.
SECTION 5:   This ordinance is declared to be an emergency measure necessary
for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare
of the people of this municipality, and shall take effect at the earliest date
provided by law.
Date
Passed: February 15, 2016
                     Robert L. Benson /s/
                     Mayor
                     Anne L. Johnson /s/
                     Clerk of the Legislative Authority
                     Anne L. Johnson

ORDINANCE NO. 12-2019
AN ORDINANCE ENACTING AND ADOPTING SUPPLEMENT TO VILLAGE OF NAVARRE CODE OF
MUNICIPAL REGULATIONS, SAID SUPPLEMENT PUBLISHED BY AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING
CORPORATION AND KNOW AS THE OHIO BASIC CODE
Whereas, American Legal Publishing Corporation of Cincinnati, Ohio, has
completed the 2019 supplement to the Code of Ordinances known as the Ohio Basic
Code, intended as a supplement to the Codified Municipal Regulations of the
Village of Navarre, which supplement contains ordinances of a general nature
enacted since the prior supplement to the Ohio Basic Code adopted previously by
the Village of Navarre, and
Whereas, American Legal Publishing Corporation has recommended revision or
addition of certain sections of the Ohio Basic Code which are based on or make
references to sections of the Ohio Revised Code, and
Whereas, it is the intent of the Village Council to accept these updated
sections in accordance with the changes in the Ohio Revised Code,
Now Therefore, the Village Council of Navarre, Ohio Ordains as follows:
   Section 1- That the 2019 supplement to the Ohio Basic Code, as submitted by
American Legal Publishing Corporation of Cincinnati, and as attached hereto, be
and the same is hereby adopted by reference as if set out in its entirety,
provided, however, that if any provision of the 2019 supplement to the Ohio
Basic Code conflicts with any Village of Navarre Codified Municipal Regulation,
that the Codified Municipal Regulations shall control and apply.
   Section 2 - That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force
immediately upon its adoption by Council and approval by the Mayor.
   First reading dated  7-1-19     5  Ayes    0  Nays
   Second reading dated  7-15-19          Ayes         Nays
   Third reading dated  8-5-19     6  Ayes    0  Nays
   
APPROVED: Robert L. Benson /s/
      Robert L. Benson, Mayor
DATE:   August 5, 2019
ATTEST:   Anne L. Johnson /s/
      Anne L. Johnson, Clerk-Treasurer
I, Anne L. Johnson, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do hereby
certify that the foregoing is a true copy of Ordinance 20-2019 duly passed and
adopted by the Council of the Village of Navarre on the 5th day of August, 2019
as compared by me with the original on file in my office.
Anne L. Johnson /s/
I, Anne L. Johnson, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do hereby
certify that there is no newspaper in said Village and that publication of the
above Ordinance was duly made by posting one copy thereof at the Village of
Navarre’s website, the Navarre Post Office and the Village Clean Laundromat and
that said Ordinance will remain posted for at least fifteen days thereafter.
Anne L. Johnson /s/
ORDINANCE NO. 4-2020
AN ORDINANCE ENACTING AND ADOPTING SUPPLEMENT TO VILLAGE OF NAVARRE CODE OF
MUNICIPAL REGULATIONS, SAID SUPPLEMENT PUBLISHED BY AMERICAN LEGAL PUBLISHING
CORPORATION AND KNOW AS THE OHIO BASIC CODE
Whereas, American Legal Publishing Corporation of Cincinnati, Ohio, has
completed the 2020 supplement to the Code of Ordinances known as the Ohio Basic
Code, intended as a supplement to the Codified Municipal Regulations of the
Village of Navarre, which supplement contains ordinances of a general nature
enacted since the prior supplement to the Ohio Basic Code adopted previously by
the Village of Navarre, and
Whereas, American Legal Publishing Corporation has recommended revision or
addition of certain sections of the Ohio Basic Code which are based on or make
references to sections of the Ohio Revised Code, and
Whereas, it is the intent of the Village Council to accept these updated
sections in accordance with the changes in the Ohio Revised Code,
Now Therefore, the Village Council of Navarre, Ohio Ordains as follows:
   Section 1- That the 2020 supplement to the Ohio Basic Code, as submitted by
American Legal Publishing Corporation of Cincinnati, the table of contents
which is attached hereto, be and the same is hereby adopted by reference as if
set out in its entirety, provided, however, that if any provision of the 2020
supplement to the Ohio Basic Code conflicts with any Village of Navarre
Codified Municipal Regulation, that the Codified Municipal Regulations shall
control and apply.
   Section 2 - That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force
immediately upon its adoption by Council and approval by the Mayor. Further,
Council deems passage of this ordinance to be an emergency so that Village law
will be as up to date as similar provisions in other Ohio municipalities,
creating a uniformity that will assist persons dealing with multiple
jurisdictions; thus this ordinance is passed by the super-majority required for
emergency ordinance, and to waive the usual three readings requirement.
APPROVED: Robert L. Benson /s/
      Robert L. Benson, Mayor
DATE:   February 17, 2020
ATTEST:   Anne L. Johnson /s/
      Anne L. Johnson, Clerk-Treasurer
I, Anne L. Johnson, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do hereby
certify that the foregoing is a true copy of Ordinance 4-2020 duly passed and
adopted by the Council of the Village of Navarre on the 17th day of February,
2020 as compared by me with the original on file in my office.
Anne L. Johnson /s/
I, Anne L. Johnson, Clerk-Treasurer for the Village of Navarre, Ohio, do hereby
certify that there is no newspaper in said Village and that publication of the
above Ordinance was duly made by posting one copy thereof at the Village of
Navarre’s website, the Navarre Post Office and the Village Clean Laundromat and
that said Ordinance will remain posted for at least fifteen days thereafter.
Anne L. Johnson /s/

enacted since the prior supplement to the Ohio Basic Code adopted previously by

GENERAL PROVISIONS
Section
   
10.19   Alternate means of providing notice of violation to persons who refuse,
do not accept, or do not take delivery of certified mail service of notices.
   
10.20   Repeat violations of ordinances requiring written notice prior to
official action
§ 10.19 ALTERNATE MEANS OF PROVIDING NOTICE OF VIOLATION TO PERSONS WHO REFUSE,
DO NOT ACCEPT, OR DO NOT TAKE DELIVERY OF CERTIFIED MAIL SERVICE OF NOTICES.
    Whenever any section of these Municipal Regulations requires that the
village serve a notice of violation by certified mail before taking further
action against, the intended recipient of the notice of violation, and if
attempted service of a notice of violation by certified mail is refused, and
the certified mail envelope shows such refusal, or if attempted service of a
notice of violation by certified mail is returned with an endorsement stating
the envelope was unclaimed, the village official that sent such notice may
serve the intended recipient of the notice with a copy of the notice of
violation by ordinary United States mail. Service of such notice of violation
shall be deemed to have been completed in accord with the applicable section of
these Municipal Regulations on the fourth business day after such notice of
violation is mailed from a United States post office.
(Ord. 9-2020, passed 6-1-20)
§ 10.20 REPEAT VIOLATIONS OF ORDINANCES REQUIRING WRITTEN NOTICE PRIOR TO
OFFICIAL ACTION.
   (A)   Application. This section applies to any other section of these
Municipal Regulations that requires that the village serve a written notice of
violation before taking further action against the intended recipient of the
notice of violation.
   (B)   Repeat violation after perfection of service of written notice. Where
service of a required written notice is perfected and is followed by a period
of apparent compliance with the applicable municipal regulation, and the notice
recipient re-engages in the same or substantially similar conduct in violation
of said municipal regulation, then the village may serve the notice recipient
with an ordinary mail dated notice of violation and demand to abate the
violation within ten days. Notice shall be deemed to have been completed
hereunder on the fourth business day after such notice is mailed from a United
States post office box.
   (C)   If the notice recipient has not abated the violation stated in the
notice in the manner set forth in the notice, within ten days after perfection
of said notice, the village may thereafter take any action authorized in the
applicable municipal regulation or ordinance.
   (D)   For this section to apply, the initial notice of violation seeking
abatement served to a person shall advise that person that subsequent notices
relating to the same or substantially similar conduct will be made under this
section.
(Ord. 19-2022, passed 10-3-22)
